marketNews.title: Qatari Investor Enters 1 Million Home Program
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Government signed a memorandum of understanding with an investor from Qatar, Qilaa International Group, on Wednesday (8/1) to build 1 million affordable homes for low-income urban communities, which is part of the government's plan to build 3 million homes per year under President Prabowo Subianto's administration. In this cooperation, the government will provide land to build apartments, prioritizing the areas of Jakarta, Banten, and West Java. Meanwhile, Qilaa International Group will act as the contractor and finance the project. However, details regarding the value and duration of this cooperation are not yet known. Besides Qatar, the Head of the Housing Task Force and President Prabowo Subianto's younger brother, Hashim Djojohadikusumo, stated in December 2024 that the United Arab Emirates would also cooperate to build 1 million affordable homes. This announcement came just a day after the Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas, Maruarar Sirait, stated that he was discussing with the President and the Public Housing Savings Management Agency (BP Tapera) to change the Tapera contribution from mandatory to voluntary. Based on existing regulations, the Tapera contribution will be mandatory for all workers earning above the minimum wage starting May 20, 2027, with a rate of 3% of monthly income. However, it is still unknown whether Maruarar's statement implies that the government will revise the Tapera regulation moving forward. Maruarar mentioned that the government is still awaiting the Constitutional Court's decision on the public lawsuit against the existing Tapera regulation.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Sustainable investor funding will support government housing program financing, potentially reducing dependency on Tapera funds. Increased certainty in the implementation of this housing program could bring positive impacts to supporting sectors, such as cement ($SMGR, $INTP), ceramics ($ARNA, $CAKK), as well as home appliances ($ACES, $MDIY, $TOTO). On the other hand, the possibility that the Tapera contribution will not be mandatory could reduce pressure on people's discretionary income, thus having a positive impact on general purchasing power.

tickerNews.title: ASII: Toyota Wholesales (-14%) and Daihatsu (-13%) Declined During FY24
tickerNews.content: $ASII: Astra International registered Toyota wholesales of 26,667 units (-17% YoY, -1% MoM) in December 2024, while Daihatsu wholesales reached 13,057 units (+2% YoY, +30% MoM). Combined, these two main ASII brands recorded a wholesales performance decline of -11% YoY and +7% MoM in December 2024, which was worse than the industry realization (-6% YoY, +7% MoM). Consequently, their combined market share dropped to 49.8% in December 2024 (vs. December 2023: 52.6%, November 2024: 49.8%). Cumulatively over FY24, Toyota wholesales reached 288,982 units (-14% YoY) and Daihatsu reached 163,032 units (-13% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BUKA Clarifies Physical Product Cessation Impact
tickerNews.content: $BUKA: Bukalapak stated in a clarification to the IDX that the cessation of physical product services on its marketplace does not have a detrimental impact on the company's business continuity. BUKA mentioned that physical product services on the marketplace contributed approximately 3% of the company's total revenue. BUKA also stated that stopping physical product services on the marketplace will support the company's efforts to achieve positive EBITDA through operational cost efficiencies. During 9M24, BUKA recorded revenue of 3.4 trillion Rupiah - with the marketplace segment recording revenue of 1.83 trillion Rupiah - and an adjusted EBITDA loss of 193 billion Rupiah.

tickerNews.title: TOTL Secures New Contracts of IDR 5.08 Trillion in 2024
tickerNews.content: $TOTL: The Corporate Secretary of Total Bangun Persada, Anggie S. Sidharta, stated that the company recorded new contract value of 5.08 trillion Rupiah throughout 2024, growing +21% YoY and exceeding (113%) the 2024 target of 4.5 trillion Rupiah. TOTL is also participating in several project tenders with a pipeline value of around 7.87 trillion Rupiah. For 2025, TOTL targets new contract value of 5 trillion Rupiah.

tickerNews.title: RATU to Provide Loan Facility to Subsidiary PJUC
tickerNews.content: $RATU: Raharja Energi Cepu announced it will provide a loan facility of approximately US$6.9 million to its business entity, PT Petrogas Jatim Utama Cendana (PJUC), with an interest rate of SOFR + 5% margin or equivalent to 10.04%. This loan facility will be used for 2025 cash call financing. PJUC itself holds a participation right of 2.2423% in the Cepu oil and gas block.

tickerNews.title: HGII Targets 100 MW of RE Power Plant Capacity by 2031
tickerNews.content: $HGII: The President Director of Hero Global Investment, Robin Sunyoto, stated that the company targets to own and manage new and renewable energy (EBT) power plants with a total capacity of 100 MW by 2031. HGII will use the proceeds from its IPO amounting to 260 billion Rupiah to build a 25 MW hydropower plant (PLTA) and a 10 MW mini-hydro power plant (PLTM), both projected to commence commercial operations in 2028. In the next 6 years, HGII also plans to build hydro power plants with a total capacity of 58 MW, as well as other EBT plants, namely 8 MW biomass, 6 MW biogas, and 10 MW solar. Meanwhile, HGII's Finance Director, Hugo Feber Parluhutan Silalahi, stated that the company targets a three-fold increase in revenue and net profit in 2025, reaching 95 billion Rupiah and 35 billion Rupiah, respectively.

tickerNews.title: AMMN Optimistic About Achieving 90,000 Ounces Gold Production Target in 2025
tickerNews.content: $AMMN: Vice President Corporate Communications of Amman Mineral Internasional, Kartika Octaviana, stated that the company targets copper production volume of 228 million pounds and gold production of 90,000 ounces in 2025, lower than the revised 2024 target of 374 million pounds of copper and 751,000 ounces of gold. Kartika told Kontan that the 2025 target reflects operational dynamics influenced by mining plans in Batu Hijau, which is currently entering the early phase 8 with low to medium ore grades. Kartika also mentioned that AMMN's focus in 2025 is completing strategic projects to support future production activities, including the final stage of commissioning the copper smelter and precious metal refining, the gas and steam power plant, LNG facilities, and processing plant expansion.

tickerNews.title: GIAA in Early Discussion Stages Regarding Merger with Pelita Air Service
tickerNews.content: $GIAA: Garuda Indonesia stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company is in the early discussion stage with relevant parties concerning the planned merger with PT Pelita Air Service. GIAA did not detail the target execution timeline for the merger, but stated that the progress of the plan will be reported further if there are significant developments. Previously, the Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, said last week that the consolidation of GIAA, PT Pelita Air Service, and PT Citilink Indonesia is targeted to be completed within the next 6 months. The consolidation plan for these three airlines was previously mentioned by Erick in August 2023, aimed at reducing logistics costs.

tickerNews.title: SSIA Subsidiary Receives Additional IDR 1.4 Trillion Credit Facility from BBCA for Hotel Renovation
tickerNews.content: $SSIA: Surya Semesta Internusa through its subsidiary, PT Suryalaya Anindita International (SAI), signed a credit agreement amendment with Bank Central Asia ($BBCA), with SAI receiving an additional credit facility of up to approximately 1.4 trillion Rupiah with a tenor of 10 years. The obtained funds will be allocated as 1.2 trillion Rupiah for capex to renovate Melia Bali Hotels & Resorts, while the remaining 215 billion Rupiah is for financing the extension of land utilization and management rights for Melia Bali Hotels & Resorts.

tickerNews.title: Domestic Automobile Wholesales in December 2024 and FY24 Realization
tickerNews.content: Gaikindo recorded that domestic automobile wholesales in December 2024 reached 79,806 units (-6.4% YoY, +7.3% MoM). This result brought the wholesales realization for 12M24 to 865,723 units (-14% YoY), equivalent to 102% of Gaikindo's revised 2024 target of 850,000 units.

tickerNews.title: Indonesia Consumer Confidence Index Rose to 127.7 in December 2024
tickerNews.content: Bank Indonesia announced that the Indonesian consumer confidence index rose to 127.7 in December 2024 (vs. November 2024: 125.9), marking the highest level since April 2024. This result was driven by an increase across all sub-indices.

tickerNews.title: China CPI Inflation Slowed to 0.1% YoY in December 2024
tickerNews.content: China's national statistics bureau recorded that Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation in China slowed to 0.1% YoY in December 2024 (vs. Nov 2024: 0.2% YoY inflation), in line with consensus expectations and marking the lowest level since March 2024. This result indicates increasing deflation risks in China, despite stimulus measures from the government and supportive monetary policy stance from the central bank. On a monthly basis, CPI inflation was flat (vs. Nov 2024: 0.6% MoM deflation), in line with consensus expectations. Meanwhile, core inflation in December 2024 reached 0.4% YoY (vs. Nov 2024: 0.3% YoY inflation).

tickerNews.title: Government to Revise Minimum Tenor for Natural Resource Export Earnings Fund Placement to 1 Year
tickerNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Wednesday (8/1) that the government will revise the minimum tenor for the placement of foreign exchange earnings from natural resources (DHE SDA) from 3 months to 1 year. However, Airlangga did not further explain whether the minimum mandatory portion of export value placement will change from the existing provision, which is 30% for SDA exporters with export values of at least 250,000 US dollars. Airlangga also mentioned that the government and Bank Indonesia are preparing incentives related to this regulation change, but he did not elaborate further. This announcement came less than a week after Kontan reported that the government would increase the portion and tenor of DHE SDA placement from a minimum of 30% for 3 months to a minimum of 50% for 6-12 months, with interest incentives up to 4.48%.

tickerNews.title: Macquarie Predicts Global Nickel Supply Reduction Due to Potential Indonesian Production Cuts
tickerNews.content: Macquarie Group Ltd. on Wednesday (8/1) estimated that potential cutting of nickel ore production in Indonesia could reduce global nickel supply from the market by -35%, thus risking a significant price increase. Previously, Bloomberg reported in December 2024 that the Indonesian government was considering cutting the nickel ore production quota from 272 million tons in 2024 to 150 million tons in 2025. Macquarie Group Ltd. assessed that production cuts on that scale are highly unlikely but noted that lower mining production from Indonesia could present an upside price risk.

tickerNews.title: Indonesian Government Encourages Local Ranchers to Import Broodstock for Free School Meal Program
tickerNews.content: The Deputy Minister of Agriculture, Sudaryono, stated on Wednesday (8/1) that the government is encouraging domestic ranchers to import live cattle to supply meat and milk for the free school lunch program, targeting an import of 400,000 head in 2025. Of this target, Sudaryono mentioned that half must be dairy cattle. The government also targets importing 2 million head of broodstock cattle by 2029, so that the demand for beef and milk for the free school meal program can be met from local supply over time. Nevertheless, the Ministry of Agriculture did not specify what incentives the government will provide to ranchers to carry out these imports.

tickerNews.title: SRAJ Prepares IDR 1 Trillion Capex for 2025
tickerNews.content: $SRAJ: The Controller and Director of Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya ($SRAJ), Arie Farisandi, stated that the company allocates a capital expenditure (capex) of 1 trillion Rupiah in 2025 (vs. 2024 capex allocation: 500 billion Rupiah). This fund will be used to complete the construction of several hospitals, such as Mayapada Hospital East Jakarta, expansion of tower 3 at Mayapada Hospital South Jakarta, and Mayapada Apollo Batam International Hospital. However, SRAJ management has not detailed the performance targets for 2025.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Director/Controller Purchases 600,000 Shares
tickerNews.content: The Controller and Director of Medikaloka Hermina ($HEAL), Yulisar Khiat, purchased 600,000 HEAL shares at an average price of 1,580 Rupiah per share on January 2, 2025. The total transaction value reached 948 million Rupiah. After this transaction, Yulisar Khiat's ownership in HEAL increased from 12.761% to 12.765%.
